overview_of_class: This course will introduce the student to the world of plants. We will begin with concepts of plant structure and physiology such as cell types, organs and photosynthesis. From this basis we will explore the evolutionary diversity of plants, culminating in the angiosperms, the dominant plants today. We will end with a study of the interactions of plants with one another, other organisms, and their environment. The goals of this course are an understanding of plant biology, the unique characteristics of plants, as well as their similarities to and relationships with other organisms. PROJECTS: Students will grow plants from seed and observe them outside of class to reinforce concepts from lecture. Students will also be working in teams to identify plants in the area surrounding the lagoon.
name: Plant Biology
title: WCAS BIOL_SCI 330-0-20 Plant Biology
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Prerequisite: Students must have completed BIOL_SCI 215 and 219 to enroll in this course.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will introduce the student to the world of plants. We will begin with concepts of plant structure and physiology such as cell types, organs and photosynthesis. From this basis we will explore the evolutionary diversity of plants, culminating in the angiosperms, the dominant plants today. We will end with a study of the interactions of plants with one another, other organisms, and their environment. The goals of this course are an understanding of plant biology, the unique characteristics of plants, as well as their similarities to and relationships with other organisms. PROJECTS: Students will grow plants from seed and observe them outside of class to reinforce concepts from lecture. Students will also be working in teams to identify plants in the area surrounding the lagoon.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be based on three exams, the projects, and 3 homework assignments.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Bidlack, J and S Jansky. 2014. Stern's Introductory Plant Biology, 13th Edition. McGraw Hill ISBN 978-0-07-336944-0 New from $97.79

subject: BIOL_SCI
